Result edu.ou.asgbook.filters.MaxValueFilter.findHighestValued ( LatLonGrid  input  )  

00027                                                      {
00028         int[][] data = input.getData();
00029         int x = -1;
00030         int y = -1;
00031         int maxval = input.getMissing();
00032         for (int i=0; i < input.getNumLat(); ++i){
00033             for (int j=0; j < input.getNumLon(); ++j){
00034                 if ( data[i][j] != input.getMissing() ){
00035                     if ( maxval == input.getMissing() ||
00036                          maxval < data[i][j] ){
00037                         x = i; // new maximum
00038                         y = j;
00039                         maxval = data[x][y];
00040                     }
00041                 }
00042             }
00043         }
00044         if ( x >=0 && y >= 0 ){
00045             LatLon loc = input.getLocation(x, y);
00046             return new Result(data[x][y], loc);
00047         }
00048         return null;
00049     }

00051                                                             {
00052         // read input
00053         LatLonGrid popdensity = GlobalPopulation.read(GlobalPopulation.NORTHAMERICA);
00054         popdensity.setMissing(0); // will get to process less data this way
00055         
00056         // find 10 highest
00057         MaxValueFilter filter = new MaxValueFilter();
00058         Result result = filter.findHighestValued(popdensity);
00059         System.out.println("Maximum is " + result.value + " at " + result.location);
